1.text: And immediately in the morning the chief priests, having taken counsel with the elders and scribes and the whole sanhedrim, bound Jesus and carried [him] away, and delivered [him] up to Pilate.

2.text: And Pilate asked him, Art thou the King of the Jews? And he answered and said to him, Thou sayest.

3.text: And the chief priests accused him urgently.

4.text: And Pilate asked him again, saying, Answerest thou nothing? See of how many things they bear witness against thee.

5.text: But Jesus still answered nothing, so that Pilate marvelled.

6.text: But at [the] feast he released to them one prisoner, whomsoever they begged [of him].

7.text: Now there was the [person] named Barabbas bound with those who had made insurrection with [him], [and] that had committed murder in the insurrection.

8.text: And the crowd crying out began to beg [that he would do] to them as he had always done.

9.text: But Pilate answered them saying, Will ye that I release to you the King of the Jews?

10.text: for he knew that the chief priests had delivered him up through envy.

11.text: But the chief priests stirred up the crowd that he might rather release Barabbas to them.

12.text: And Pilate answering said to them again, What will ye then that I do [to him] whom ye call King of the Jews?

13.text: And they cried out again, Crucify him.

14.text: And Pilate said to them, What evil then has he done? But they cried out the more urgently, Crucify him.

15.text: And Pilate, desirous of contenting the crowd, released to them Barabbas, and delivered up Jesus, when he had scourged him, that he might be crucified.

16.text: And the soldiers led him away into the court which is [called the] praetorium, and they call together the whole band.

17.text: And they clothe him with purple, and bind round on him a crown of thorns which they had plaited.

18.text: And they began to salute him, Hail, King of the Jews!

19.text: And they struck his head with a reed, and spat on him, and, bending the knee, did him homage.

20.text: And when they had mocked him, they took the purple off him, and put his own clothes on him; and they lead him out that they may crucify him.

21.text: And they compel to go [with them] a certain passer-by, Simon, a Cyrenian, coming from the field, the father of Alexander and Rufus, that he might carry his cross.

22.text: And they bring him to the place [called] Golgotha, which, being interpreted, is Place of a skull.

23.text: And they offered him wine [to drink] medicated with myrrh; but he did not take [it].

24.text: And having crucified him, they part his clothes amongst [themselves], casting lots on them, what each one should take.

25.text: And it was the third hour, and they crucified him.

26.text: And the superscription of what he was accused of was written up: The King of the Jews.

27.text: And with him they crucify two robbers, one on his right hand, and one on his left.

28.text: [And the scripture was fulfilled which says, And he was reckoned with the lawless.]

29.text: And they that passed by reviled him, shaking their heads, and saying, Aha, thou that destroyest the temple and buildest it in three days,

30.text: save thyself, and descend from the cross.

31.text: In like manner the chief priests also, with the scribes, mocking with one another, said, He saved others; himself he cannot save.

32.text: Let the Christ the King of Israel descend now from the cross, that we may see and may believe. And they that were crucified with him reproached him.

33.text: And when [the] sixth hour was come, there came darkness over the whole land until [the] ninth hour;

34.text: and at the ninth hour, Jesus cried with a loud voice, [saying], Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani? which is, being interpreted, My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?

35.text: And some of those who stood by, when they heard [it], said, Behold, he calls for Elias.

36.text: And one, running and filling a sponge with vinegar, fixed it on a reed, and gave him to drink, saying, Let alone, let us see if Elias comes to take him down.

37.text: And Jesus, having uttered a loud cry, expired.

38.text: And the veil of the temple was rent in two from the top to the bottom.

39.text: And the centurion who stood by over against him, when he saw that he had expired having thus cried out, said, Truly this man was Son of God.

40.text: And there were women also looking on from afar off, among whom were both Mary of Magdala, and Mary the mother of James the less and of Joses, and Salome;

41.text: who also, when he was in Galilee, followed him and ministered to him; and many others who came up with him to Jerusalem.

42.text: And when it was already evening, since it was [the] preparation, that is, [the day] before a sabbath,

43.text: Joseph of Arimathaea, an honourable councillor, who also himself was awaiting the kingdom of God, coming, emboldened himself and went in to Pilate and begged the body of Jesus.

44.text: And Pilate wondered if he were already dead; and having called to [him] the centurion, he inquired of him if he had long died.

45.text: And when he knew from the centurion, he granted the body to Joseph.

46.text: And having bought fine linen, [and] having taken him down, he swathed him in the fine linen, and laid him in a sepulchre which was cut out of rock, and rolled a stone to the door of the sepulchre.

47.text: And Mary of Magdala and Mary the [mother] of Joses saw where he was put.
